law.catch_line: Eligibility for license -- Examinations -- Applications for license.

text.section: Licenses to engage in the practice of optometry shall be issued only to those who qualify under the provisions of KRS 320.260 or 320.270, or who successfully pass examinations conducted or approved by the board at a time and place fixed by the board. Each license certificate shall be signed by the president and secretary-treasurer and authenticated by the seal of the board.

The examinations may consist of written, clinical, or practical examinations and shall relate to the skills needed for the practice of optometry in this Commonwealth at the time of the examination and shall seek to determine the applicant's preparedness to exercise these skills. The examining board may:
Prepare, administer, and grade the examination;
Accept the scores of the applicant from an examination prepared, administered, and graded by the National Board of Examiners in Optometry or any other organization approved by the board as qualified to administer the examination; and
Require passage of an examination on Kentucky optometric law.
The nonrefundable fee for each license application shall not exceed six hundred dollars ($600).

No application shall be considered by the board after one (1) year from the date in which the board received the application has lapsed. After the lapse of the one (1) year period, an applicant shall submit a new application and another nonrefundable fee for further consideration by the board.

law.history: Amended 2015 Ky. Acts ch. 113, sec. 19, effective June 24, 2015. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 361, sec. 5, effective July 14, 2000. -- Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 256, sec. 9, effective July 13, 1990; and ch. 443, sec. 24, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 337, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1982. -- Amended 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 120, sec. 12. -- Created 1954 Ky. Acts ch. 183, sec. 6.
